author: jerenkrantz
msg: Always initialize ->method_string.
* flood_round_robin.c
(parse_xml_url_info): If we don't have a method attribute, set ->method_string
to GET.

author: dims
msg: woohoo! all our perf fixes are in! (http://www.nabble.com/Woodstox-3.2.0-released-%28SAX2-API-impl%2C-writer-side-fixes%29-tf2893457.html#a8084071)

author: craigmcc
msg: [SHALE-381] First pass at abstracting out the Rolodex APIs into a generic
API module, plus an initial implementation for a memory-based database.
At least the following FIXME issues need to be addressed:
* Add a helper class to shale-rolodex-dao which returns the JSF
SelectItem[] lists relevant to a webapp.  JSF will be an optional
dependency, because you should only need the extra class in a JSF app.
* Flesh out the Digester rules and loading of the default resources for
shale-rolodex-dao-memory
* Construct a JPA based implementation (shale-rolodex-dao-jpa) as well,
both to verify the accuracy of the basic APIs and to support apps that
want a persistent data version of this.
* Probably at shale-goodies due to LGPL issues, do the same for a
pure Hibernate implementation.

author: craigmcc
msg: First pass at updating the API stability page for SHALE-379.  Major changes:
* Divide into two tables, one for app developers and one for
framework extenders, with a column for which module jar contains
the corresponding classes.
* FIXME - need to review whether shale-clay classes are intended
for direct application use.
* FIXME - need to review the proposed stability rankings and add
any relevant additional comments.
